data.name: XAccessibleStateSet
desc: Implement this interface to represent a set of states.
The interface XAccessibleStateSet represents a set of states of an accessible object. It can hold any combination of states defined by the constants collection AccessibleStateType.

methods.name: contains
desc: Checks if the given state is a member of the state set of the called object.

methods.name: containsAll
desc: Checks if all of the given states are in the state set of the called object.

methods.name: getStates
desc: Get all currently set states as a sequence of state ids.

The purpose of this function is to reduce the communication between accessibility objects and AT. Without this function an AT-Tool had to call contains() for every state type. Now a single call is sufficient.

methods.name: isEmpty
desc: Checks whether the current state set is empty.
